data.title: Mystery Reader's Advisory
data.text:
If You Like...

Unreliable Narrators

Did you like Gone Girl or The Girl on the Train? Are you drawn in by the possibility that the narrator might not be telling you the truth? Then check out these shifty authors:

​

Fiona Barton

J.P. Delaney

A. J. Finn

Gillian Flynn

Paula Hawkins

Clare Mackintosh

Kimberly McCreight

B.A. Paris

Wendy Walker

Minette Walters

Ruth Ware

S.J. Watson

​

​

The English Mystery

These authors can trace their roots back to Agatha Christie, though perhaps with a bit more danger, suspense and technology. If you are a fan of P.D. James or Elizabeth George, then these modern sleuths might appeal to you:

​

Kate Atkinson

Jo Bannister

Ann Cleeves

Deborah Crombie

Colin Dexter

Christopher Fowler

Tana French

Elizabeth George

Elly Griffiths

Martha Grimes

P.D. James

Peter James

Peter Lovesey

G.M. Malliet

Peter May

Val McDermid

Louise Penny

Ian Rankin

Ruth Rendell

Peter Robinson

​

​

Scandinavian Thrillers

Scandinavian authors have a distinct style all their own. If you liked the The Girl with the Dragon Tattoo, here are a few other authors that have same gritty appeal:

​

Jussi Adler-Olsen

Kjell Eriksson

Karin Fossum

Arnaldur Indridason

Ragnar Jonasson

Camilla Lackberg

Stieg Larsson

Henning Mankell

Jo Nesbo

​

​

Spy Thrillers

International intrigue, exotic locales, the fate of the world hanging in the balance...if this sounds like the adventure you have been looking for, check out these spy masters:

​

Alex Berenson

Charles Cumming

Joseph Kanon

Philip Kerr

John Le Carre

Robert Ludlum

Christopher Reich

Daniel Silva

Olen Steinhauer

​

No Rules Thrillers

Do you ask yourself "What would Reacher do?" as you are reading a thriller? Here are some series that feature good guys and gals who aren't afraid to bust out their tough side in the pursuit of justice:

​

Lee Child

John Connolly

Joseph Finder

Gregg Hurwitz

Dean Koontz

Thomas Perry

Nick Petrie

​

​

Political & Military Thrillers

These heroes are spies, politicians and military men. They might have different world views, but they all agree that they would do anything to defend and protect their country:

​

David Baldacci

Ted Bell

Larry Bond

Dale Brown

Tom Clancy

Stephen Coontz

Vince Flynn

W.E.B. Griffin

Jack Higgins

Stephen Hunter

Brad Meltzer

Joel Rosenberg

Brad Taylor

Brad Thor

Margaret Truman

​

​

Thriller Masters

Domestic, psychological or scary? Unlikely hero or avenging mom? Serial killers or just serial criminals? However you like your thrillers, these masters of the craft will keep you on the edge of your seat.

​

Linwood Barclay

Lisa Black

Sharon Bolton

Alafair Burke

Chelsea Cain

Jane Casey

Mary Higgins Clark

Harlan Coben

Jeffrey Deaver

Joy Fielding

Meg Gardiner

Andrew Gross

Sophie Hannah

John Hart

Greg Iles

Alex Kava

T. Jefferson Parker

James Patterson

Ridley Pearson

John Sandford

Karin Slaughter

Chevy Stevens

Lisa Unger

​

​

Hard-Boiled Mysteries

Do you like your detectives with a certain amount of gritty swagger? These leading men walk the line as they rid the mean streets of criminals:

​

Ace Atkins

Lawrence Block

Ken Bruen

Max Allan Collins

Stuart Kaminsky

Dennis Lehane

Elmore Leonard

John MacDonald

Ed McBain

Walter Mosley

Stuart Neville

Bill Pronzini

Mickey Spillane

Rex Stout

Andrew Vachss

Donald Westlake

Mysteries in the Great Outdoors

Sometimes the setting is as much a character in a story as the people. Travel to some of the wild places of the United States with these intrepid sleuths:

​

Nevada Barr

C.J. Box

Paul Doiron

Sue Henry

Tony Hillerman

Craig Johnson

William Kent Krueger

​

​

Medical Thrillers

Are you intrigued by forensic science? If you don't get squeamish about the details, then these thrillers are for you:

​

Jefferson Bass

Robin Cook

Patricia Cornwell

Tess Gerritsen

Michael Palmer

Kathy Reichs

​

​

Art & History

Dan Brown showed readers that you could enjoy a good thriller and learn something about art and history at the same time:

​

Steve Berry

Dan Brown

Raymond Khoury

David Morrell

Douglas Preston & Lincoln Child

Matthew Reilly

James Rollins

Police, Detectives and PI's

They get paid to track down the bad guys, but for these men and women, truth and justice are more than just a job.

​

Linda Barnes

M.C. Beaton

James Lee Burke

Jan Burke

Linda Castillo

Richard Castle

Michael Connelly

Robert Crais

Aaron Elkins

Dick Francis

Lisa Gardner

Sue Grafton

J.A. Jance

Faye Kellerman

Michael Koryta

Lynda LaPlante

Dennis Lehane

Laura Lippman

Archer Mayor

Ross MacDonald

Margaret Maron

Marcia Muller

Sara Paretsky

Barbara Parker

Robert B. Parker

J.D. Robb

Julia Spencer-Fleming

Joseph Wambaugh

Randy Wayne White

Stuart Woods

​

​

Laugh Out Loud Mysteries

Do you wish that Stephanie Plum was your BFF? Here are some mystery writers that add a twist of comedy with their crime:

​

Ellen Byerrum

Meg Cabot

Joelle Charbonneau

Tim Dorsey

Janet Evanovich

Charlaine Harris

Darynda Jones

Sharon Kahn

Laura Levine

Lisa Lutz

Nancy Martin

Elaine Viets

​

​

Amateur Sleuths

Do you relate to Miss Marple? These leading ladies do too - solving mysteries with their wits, despite not having the proper credentials:

​

Susan Wittig Albert

Donna Andrews

Nancy Atherton

Dorothy Cannell

Jill Churchill

Mary Daheim

Jeanne Dams

Carolyn Hart

Katherine Hall Page

Cynthia Riggs

​

Romantic Thrillers

Who says you can't find true love while solving a crime? These writers know how to turn up the heat:

​

Suzanne Brockman

Sandra Brown

Catherine Coulter

Heather Graham

Tami Hoag

Kay Hooper

Linda Howard

Lisa Jackson

Iris Johansen

Jayne Ann Krentz

Elizabeth Lowell

Carla Neggers

Karen Robards

Nora Roberts

​

​

Solving Mysteries with a Furry Friend

Everything is better when you have your best friend at your side. These amateur sleuths solve crimes with the aid of their intuitive four-legged pals:

​

Laurien Berenson

Lilian Jackson Braun

Rita Mae Brown

Susan Conant

Krista Davis

Carole Nelson Douglas

Miranda James

Spencer Quinn

David Rosenfelt

​

​

Food Mysteries

Here are some sleuths that understand that you can solve crime much faster if there are snacks involved:

​

Alexander Campion

Chris Cavender

Laura Childs

Cleo Coyle

Diane Mott Davidson

Joanne Fluke

G.A. McKevett

Jenn McKinlay

Leslie Meier

Tamar Myers

​

​

Legal Thrillers

Are you fascinated by the courtroom drama? These legal eagles defend the innocent and put the bad guys behind bars:

​

Michael Connelly

Nelson Demille

Barry Eisler

Linda Fairstein

James Grippando

John Grisham

John Lescroart

Steve Martini

Richard North Patterson

Nancy Taylor Rosenberg

Hank Phillippi Ryan

Lisa Scottoline

Robert Tanenbaum

William Tapply

Scott Turow

Kate White

Norb Vonnegut

​

​

Mystery in a Foreign Land

Are you a world traveler? Or just wish you were? These authors will take you around the world with their stories of mystery and suspense:

​

Cara Black

Andrea Camilleri

Michael Dibdin

Donna Leon

Sujata Massey

Deon Meyer

Kwei Quartey

Alexander McCall Smith

Martin Cruz Smith

Mario Vichi

​

Historical Mysteries

Perhaps you would rather travel back in time, when detectives had only their wits, and not a smart phone, to help them catch a killer:

​

Tasha Alexander

Stephanie Barron

Carrie Bebris

Benjamin Black

Rhys Bowen

Alan Bradley

Alys Clare

Barbara Cleverly

Lindsey Davis

Carola Dunn

Marjorie Eccles

Charles Finch

Ariana Franklin

Dorothy Gilman

Susanna Gregory

Karen Harper

C.S. Harris

Michael Jecks

Laurie King

Anne Perry

Elizabeth Peters

Amanda Quick

Deanna Raybourn

C.J. Sansom

Steven Saylor

Victoria Thompson

Charles Todd

Peter Tremayne

Jacqueline Winspear

​
